speaker: Tomb of Names
lines: Your hand writes more steadily than you expected.
The milk paint dries the moment it meets the stone; the letters look older than you are.
When you place the name, a draft passes through you like a key finding a lock.
Somewhere above, the bell you didn't hear ring stops not ringing.
You feel lighter where a weight used to sit and heavier where a light used to hide.
Footsteps approach that make no sound because they have earned the right to be quiet.
When they stop, something like a hand rests on your shoulder and chooses not to press.
A voice that is not sound asks if you are finished being only yourself.

choices.text: Say yes and step where the draft is going.
Say no and take your name back down.
